decks.notes: This deck aims to quickly reduce its own life total to increase the power of Death's Shadow, a key threat that can end the game in just a few attacks. It combines aggressive creatures like Gurmag Angler and Snapcaster Mage with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial to control the board and protect its key threats. The deck also utilizes cantrips such as Serum Visions and Mishra's Bauble to dig for key cards and fuel delve creatures. By efficiently managing resources and leveraging its life total, this deck seeks to apply pressure and close out games swiftly.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard and utilizing cards like Burning Inquiry and Goblin Lore to discard cards while also generating value with Flameblade Adept. By aggressively casting spells and creatures from the graveyard, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats like Gurmag Angler and Hollow One, while maintaining pressure with Bloodghast and Flamewake Phoenix. The deck can quickly close out games with its aggressive playstyle and ability to constantly refill the board with threats.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage. Using a combination of counterspells like Logic Knot and Cryptic Command, removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile, along with card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Search for Azcanta, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent. The win condition comes from cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, and Secure the Wastes, while using Celestial Colonnade as a backup win condition.

The deck focuses on using UrzaTron lands to assemble a large amount of mana quickly, allowing for the casting of powerful spells and creatures. It includes a mix of counterspells, removal, card draw, and powerful threats to control the game and eventually overwhelm the opponent with a combination of strong creatures like Wurmcoil Engine and Thought-Knot Seer, as well as game-ending spells like Emrakul, the Promised End and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck aims to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while establishing its own dominance.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on early disruption and removal spells like Fatal Push, Abrupt Decay, and Thoughtseize to clear the path for efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant. The deck also includes graveyard hate with Scavenging Ooze and card advantage with cards like Tireless Tracker. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with Treetop Village and Field of Ruin. The deck aims to apply early pressure while maintaining control of the board with a mix of removal, disruption, and threats.

This deck is focused on dealing damage quickly and efficiently to the opponent. It utilizes low-cost spells and creatures to constantly pressure the opponent's life total, aiming to end the game as fast as possible. The main strategy is to have a high amount of direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Boros Charm to burn the opponent's life total while also deploying aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Eidolon of the Great Revel to maintain a steady stream of damage. The mana base is optimized for fast and consistent casting of red spells.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and removal spells to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with hand disruption spells. The deck combines powerful creature threats like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf with versatile removal options like Lightning Bolt and Kolaghan's Command. Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption and the deck's land base allows for consistent mana fixing. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish board presence and control the game's tempo to secure a victory.

The main theme of the deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to control the board with cards like Terminus and Path to Exile, while also generating card advantage through cards like Ancestral Vision and Search for Azcanta. The inclusion of Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide additional card advantage and powerful win conditions. Overall, the deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while maintaining control of the game until it can establish a dominant position.

The deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays, utilizing efficient removal spells and disruptive cards to control the board while deploying powerful threats like Tarmogoyf, Scavenging Ooze, Dark Confidant, and Bloodbraid Elf. The mana base is optimized for consistent access to all the necessary colors, allowing for smooth casting of spells. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature pressure, removal, and disruption, pushing the game to a swift conclusion.

The main focus of this deck is to lower your own life total to power up your Death's Shadow creature, while also disrupting your opponent's strategy with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. You have access to cheap removal like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, as well as protection with cards like Stubborn Denial. You can also dig through your deck quickly with Mishra's Bauble and Faithless Looting to find your threats like Gurmag Angler and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. This aggressive strategy aims to quickly overwhelm your opponent and close out the game.

This Jund Modern deck focuses on aggressive play, using a mix of efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and aggressive planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil to pressure opponents quickly. The deck includes a variety of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate to deal with threats and disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's hand. It aims to apply pressure early on and maintain board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately overwhelming them with a mix of creatures and removal spells.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent by efficiently utilizing burn spells, direct damage spells, and aggressive creatures. The goal is to apply constant pressure and force the opponent to react quickly, often leading to a fast victory before they can stabilize. Cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide help with early aggression, while burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike provide reach to finish off the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Searing Blaze also punishes opponents for playing spells, adding additional pressure.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with fast and efficient creatures and burn spells. By playing aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear early on, combined with direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, the goal is to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. Cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel punish the opponent for playing spells, while Atarka's Command provides reach and additional damage. The land base is optimized for consistent mana and the ability to fetch the necessary colors for spells.

This UW Control deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal spells while drawing cards and gaining card advantage. It aims to stabilize the board and control the game until it can win with powerful finishers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck includes a mix of proactive and reactive spells, along with versatile creatures like Vendilion Clique and Snapcaster Mage. Utilizing lands like Celestial Colonnade and Search for Azcanta, it aims to outvalue the opponent and win through control and card advantage.
